newsitem.title: USA: UAL flight attendants to consider proposal.
newsitem.headline: UAL flight attendants to consider proposal.

text.p: The Association of Flight Attendants, representing United Airlines flight attendants, said Thursday it agreed to a three week recess in talks to allow the union to consider a labor contract proposed by the carrier.
United Airlines is a subsidiary of UAL Corp.
The AFA represents 21,000 United Airlines flight attendants.
"At the request of a private mediator, the parties agreed to a three-week recess to allow AFA to consider a comprehensive company proposal," the AFA said in a statement received here.
"The parties have expressed satisfaction with the progress made in bargaining to date and look forward to resuming negotiations in Honolulu in early June," it said.

AFA's contract became amendable in March 1996. The last proposal was rejected on April 9, 1996 by the union membership. There have been concentrated negotiations for the last month in Hawaii, an AFA spokeswoman told Reuters.
"We are pleased with the progress so far and look forward to resuming talks in June," a United Airlines spokeswoman said.
